questions.question: What is the first thing you do in the morning?

What does 'daily routine' mean?
options: Things you do once a year
Things you do on a holiday
The things you do every day in the same order
questions.correct_answer: The things you do every day in the same order

questions.question: Which of these is a household chore?
I always ____ my homework before I watch television.
After dinner, my family and I often ____ about our day.

options: The time spent relaxing at home
The journey between your home and school/work
questions.correct_answer: The journey between your home and school/work

questions.question: On weekends, my routine is more ____.

options: To choose a time for the clock to ring

questions.question: The first class of the school day is the first ____.

options: An activity like sports or music done after school hours

questions.question: I usually ____ my room on Sundays.

options: A story you write in bed
A story told before someone goes to sleep
questions.correct_answer: A story told before someone goes to sleep

questions.question: I always ____ my lunch to school.

options: To be present in the classes

questions.question: After my evening snack, I usually go out to ____.

options: A schedule showing the times of daily activities
questions.correct_answer: A schedule showing the times of daily activities

questions.question: Doing some light exercise in the morning can make you feel ____.
What is the opposite of 'staying up late'?

options: Finishing homework and packing the bag for the next day
Chatting with friends on the phone for hours
questions.correct_answer: Finishing homework and packing the bag for the next day

questions.question: The phrase 'wind down' means to:
options: relax after a period of activity
questions.correct_answer: relax after a period of activity

questions.question: My daily routine on a weekday is very different from my routine on a ____.
The period after sunset and before bedtime is the ____.
What is the benefit of having a daily routine?
options: It helps you manage your time well.
It is a waste of time.
questions.correct_answer: It helps you manage your time well.

questions.question: I ____ the school bus at the bus stop every morning.
What does 'grooming' include in a daily routine?
options: Combing hair, cutting nails, and keeping clean
questions.correct_answer: Combing hair, cutting nails, and keeping clean

questions.question: The school ____ ends at 3 PM.

options: Brush your teeth and change into nightclothes

questions.question: The activities you do every day are your daily ____.

options: To stick to a planned schedule
To change the routine every day
questions.correct_answer: To stick to a planned schedule

questions.question: A person who stays up late at night is a ____.
Daily ____ helps in keeping your body fit.
I ____ a shower every morning.
What are 'daily chores'?
options: Regular tasks like cleaning and washing
questions.correct_answer: Regular tasks like cleaning and washing

questions.question: The time just before the sun rises is called ____.
What is the term for a person's regular way of life or style of living?
The phrase 'to call it a day' means to:
options: name the day of the week.

questions.question: What does it mean to have a 'hectic' schedule?
options: To have a very relaxed and easy schedule
To have a very busy and rushed schedule
To have no schedule at all
questions.correct_answer: To have a very busy and rushed schedule

questions.question: The time of day just after sunset is known as ____.
Which of these describes a routine that doesn't change?
To 'prioritize' tasks in a daily routine means to:
options: decide which tasks are most important and do them first.
do the tasks in a random order.
questions.correct_answer: decide which tasks are most important and do them first.

questions.question: What is 'procrastination'?
options: The action of delaying or postponing something
questions.correct_answer: The action of delaying or postponing something

questions.question: A person who works from home has a ____ routine.
The phrase 'burning the midnight oil' means:
options: to go to bed very early.
to study or work late into the night.
to use an oil lamp for studying.
to waste time in the evening.
questions.correct_answer: to study or work late into the night.

questions.question: What is 'time management'?
options: The ability to use one's time effectively or productively
The study of the history of time
questions.correct_answer: The ability to use one's time effectively or productively

questions.question: A daily routine that is very monotonous is ____.
The period between regular activities, especially work, is one's ____ time.
Which of these is a synonym for 'schedule'?
What does it mean to 'adhere to' a routine?
options: To believe in and follow a routine
questions.correct_answer: To believe in and follow a routine

questions.question: The phrase 'nine-to-five' typically refers to a standard ____.
A person's natural rhythm for sleeping and waking is their ____ rhythm.
What are 'errands'?
options: Short trips to perform a specific task, like buying groceries
questions.correct_answer: Short trips to perform a specific task, like buying groceries

questions.question: If your routine is 'second nature' to you, it means you...
options: have to force yourself to do it.
are just starting a new routine.

questions.question: To 'multitask' means to ____.
options: do many different tasks at the same time
ask for help with a task
questions.correct_answer: do many different tasks at the same time

questions.question: Which phrase means to start a day feeling fresh and energetic?
options: To wake up on the wrong side of the bed

questions.question: A 'sedentary' lifestyle, often part of a daily routine, involves a lot of ____.
options: sitting down and not being active
questions.correct_answer: sitting down and not being active

questions.question: What is the term for the normal, ordinary, and often boring routine of life?
To 'allocate' time for a task means to ____.
options: assign a certain amount of time for it
questions.correct_answer: assign a certain amount of time for it

questions.question: If your routine is 'disrupted', it is ____.
The phrase 'to get a move on' is an informal way to say ____.

options: regulated system of diet, exercise, or other activity
questions.correct_answer: regulated system of diet, exercise, or other activity

questions.question: What does the idiom 'to burn the candle at both ends' mean?
options: To use a candle for light
To work from early morning until late at night
To be very efficient with your work
questions.correct_answer: To work from early morning until late at night

questions.question: A 'snooze button' on an alarm clock allows you to ____.
options: sleep for a short additional period
questions.correct_answer: sleep for a short additional period

questions.question: If you are 'swamped' with homework, you have ____.
options: a very large amount of homework
questions.correct_answer: a very large amount of homework

questions.question: To 'unwind' after a long day at school means to ____.
A student's 'course load' refers to the ____.
options: total number of courses or subjects they are taking
questions.correct_answer: total number of courses or subjects they are taking

questions.question: What does 'work-life balance' mean?
options: A proper balance between personal life and work
questions.correct_answer: A proper balance between personal life and work

questions.question: The phrase 'to hit the hay' is an idiom that means ____.
Which of these is NOT a synonym for 'routine'?
A 'stickler' for routine is someone who...
options: insists on sticking to a routine very strictly.
questions.correct_answer: insists on sticking to a routine very strictly.

questions.question: If you 'fit something in' your schedule, you...
The phrase 'dawn till dusk' refers to the period from ____.
A 'mundane' task in a routine is one that is ____.
What is 'self-care' in the context of a daily routine?
options: Activities done to take care of one's own well-being
questions.correct_answer: Activities done to take care of one's own well-being

questions.question: The phrase 'to get into the swing of things' means to:
options: become accustomed to a new routine.
questions.correct_answer: become accustomed to a new routine.

questions.question: What does it mean to 'streamline' a routine?
options: To make it more efficient and simpler
questions.correct_answer: To make it more efficient and simpler

questions.question: A 'creature of habit' is someone who...
options: likes to do the same thing at the same time every day.
questions.correct_answer: likes to do the same thing at the same time every day.

questions.question: What are 'household amenities'?
options: Features that provide comfort or convenience at home, like a washing machine
questions.correct_answer: Features that provide comfort or convenience at home, like a washing machine

questions.question: The phrase 'all in a day's work' is used to say that a difficult task is...
options: part of what is expected in a normal routine.
questions.correct_answer: part of what is expected in a normal routine.

questions.question: If you 'block out' time in your schedule, you...
options: reserve that time for a specific activity.
questions.correct_answer: reserve that time for a specific activity.

questions.question: What is 'me time' in a daily routine?
options: Time spent doing what you want to do for yourself
questions.correct_answer: Time spent doing what you want to do for yourself

questions.question: The 'rat race' is an idiom for a way of life with...
options: a fierce, competitive struggle for power and money.
a lot of time for family.
questions.correct_answer: a fierce, competitive struggle for power and money.

questions.question: A 'to-do list' helps you to...
options: remember the tasks you need to complete.
questions.correct_answer: remember the tasks you need to complete.

questions.question: What does it mean if a routine becomes 'second nature'?
options: You can do it automatically without thinking
questions.correct_answer: You can do it automatically without thinking

questions.question: To 'juggle' multiple tasks means to...
options: do only one task at a time.
try to manage and deal with several tasks at once.
ask someone else to do your tasks.
questions.correct_answer: try to manage and deal with several tasks at once.
